questions.question_text: Which endpoint type is used when the entries are pushed down from the COOP database of the spine switches to the ACI leaf switches?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
A bounce entry is basically a remote endpoint created by COOP communication instead of data plane learning.

Selected Answer: A
In Cisco ACI, remote endpoints are entries that are not directly connected to a local leaf switch but are learned via the COOP (Council of Oracle Protocol) database stored on the spine switches. When a leaf switch needs to forward traffic to an endpoint that is not locally connected, it queries the spine's COOP database to retrieve the necessary information about the remote endpoint.

Selected Answer: D
A bounce entry is basically a remote endpoint created by COOP communication instead of data-plane learning.

questions.question_text: What must be enabled in the bridge domain to have the endpoint table learn the IP addresses of endpoints?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
IP = Unicast Routing

Selected Answer: C
Unicast Routing is correct

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer must configure a bridge domain inside the Cisco ACI fabric called BD. The configuration must permit EP2 and EP3 to reach EP1. Which configuration must be applied on the bridge domain to accomplish this goal?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct

Selected Answer: D
While enabling L2 Unknown Unicast flooding ensures that traffic is flooded to all ports when the destination MAC address is unknown, this does not directly achieve unicast routing between EPs. Unicast routing is more efficient for known unicast traffic.

choices.A: Define the Pervasive gateway on BD.

questions.question_text: An engineer must configure an export policy that regularly backs up Cisco APIC configuration to a remote location. The backup must be sent by using a secure and encrypted protocol. Which configuration set must be used?

choices.B:
Configure the export policy with the required export destination.
Set the export destination as SSH.
Set the scheduler settings to recurring.
choices.C:
Configure the export policy with the required export destination.
Set the export destination as SCP.
Set the scheduler settings to recurring.
choices.A:
Configure the export policy with the required export destination.
Set the export destination as TLS.
Configure the scheduler with a maximum number of nodes.
choices.D:
Configure the export policy with the required export destination.
Set the export destination as AES.
Configure the scheduler with a maximum number of nodes.

comments.content: Should be C, your answer is for Q312

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Add IP 10.43.145.1 under Tacacs_ProvGro: The TACACS+ server IP must be added to the TACACS+ provider group (Tacacs_ProvGro) to enable authentication requests to be sent to the correct server.
Associate Tacacs_ProvGro to Domain_1: Associating the provider group with the login domain (Domain_1) ensures that users logging in through this domain are authenticated using the specified TACACS+ server.
Set realm to TACACS+ under default AAA authentication: Configuring the default AAA authentication realm to TACACS+ ensures that users do not need to manually set the domain (Domain_1) during login, as the system will default to using TACACS+ for authentication.
This configuration ensures seamless login using TACACS+ credentials without requiring users to specify the domain explicitly during login

questions.question_text: Which service graph option creates a permit entry for the traffic from the provider EPG to the provider connector of the PBR node?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
direct connect should be enabled
